intro: Hieracium sublasiophyllum, commonly known as the slender-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, with leaves that are narrow and often slightly serrated. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium sublasiophyllum is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates.
